author: scheu
msg: Merging the explicitHeaderWork into the head branch.
Summary of changes:
* Support for explicit soap header parameters.
(parameters and return values that are part of the
SEI that are passed to/from headers). Includes:
* WSDD parameter inHeader and outHeader attributes
that designate a parameter as being passed in/out
of a header.
* WSDD operation returnHeader attribute to designate
that a return value is passed back in a header.
* Analagous changes to the org.apache.axis.description classes.
* Changed the emitter to generate the new attributes in deploy.wsdd.
* Changes to the emitter to generate stubs that pass
parameters in headers and expect return values from headers.
* Minor changes to the Call api to support the stub changes.
* Changes to RPCElement/RPCHandler to deserialize parameters
from headers.
* Changes to RPCProvider (and new RPCHeaderParam class) to
serialize parameters/return values in headers.
* Added support for the Use enumeration (comparable to the Style
enumeration).  This was necessary to support rpc/literal.
* Added a Use enumeration.  Added notes to the Style enumeration
to describe the combinations of Use/Style.
* The WSDD service now has a "use" attribute.  The default
setting for use depends on the "style" setting.  The default
is use=encoded for style=rpc; otherwise the default is use=literal.
* Changed the emitter to generate the use attribute in deploy.wsdd.
* Changed the WSDD files, description classes and other classes to
pass around the Use information.  (Every place that queried/manipulated
Style now does the same with Use.)
* Changed the runtime to use the Use attribute during serialization/deserialization
as appropriate.
* Changed the emitter to use Use/Style instead of hard-coded integer constants.
